summary: This SaaS agreement is extremely one-sided in favor of the Provider, with multiple high-severity risks including uncapped customer liability, perpetual data rights grants, non-refundable fees, and automatic renewals with excessive notice requirements. The contract lacks standard customer protections and contains several potentially unenforceable clauses.

risks.location: CUSTOMER'S LIABILITY TO PROVIDER IS UNCAPPED AND INCLUDES INDEMNIFICATION FOR ANY THIRD-PARTY CLAIMS ARISING FROM CUSTOMER'S USE OF THE PLATFORM
risks.explanation: Customer has unlimited indemnification liability with no caps or exclusions, creating potentially catastrophic financial exposure
risks.suggested_fix: Cap indemnification at 12 months of fees and exclude Provider's gross negligence
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Customer's indemnification liability shall be capped at twelve (12) months of fees paid and shall exclude claims arising from Provider's gross negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement.

risks.location: Customer shall indemnify Provider against any regulatory fines, penalties, or enforcement actions, including those arising from Provider's processing of Customer data
risks.explanation: Customer must indemnify Provider even for Provider's own regulatory violations in data processing
risks.suggested_fix: Limit indemnification to Customer's own compliance violations, not Provider's processing
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Customer shall indemnify Provider only for regulatory violations arising solely from Customer's non-compliant data or instructions, excluding Provider's processing methods or security failures.

risks.location: PROVIDER'S TOTAL LIABILITY SHALL NOT EXCEED THE FEES PAID IN THE 3 MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM
risks.explanation: Provider's liability cap is extremely low (3 months vs. standard 12 months) and non-mutual
risks.suggested_fix: Increase cap to 12 months and make limitation mutual
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Each party's total liability shall not exceed the fees paid in the twelve (12) months preceding the claim, except for breaches of confidentiality, IP infringement, or gross negligence.

risks.location: Agreement automatically renews for successive 24-month periods unless Customer provides written cancellation notice 180 days prior to renewal. Early termination requires payment of all remaining fees for the full term
risks.explanation: Excessive 180-day notice requirement and penalty for early termination creates vendor lock-in
risks.suggested_fix: Reduce notice to 30-60 days and allow termination for convenience without penalty
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Agreement renews for successive one-year periods unless either party provides sixty (60) days written notice. Either party may terminate for convenience with ninety (90) days notice without penalty.

risks.location: Fees are non-refundable under any circumstances, including service outages, early termination, or Provider's breach. Provider may increase fees at any time with 15 days written notice
risks.explanation: No refunds even for Provider's breach and unilateral fee increases with minimal notice
risks.suggested_fix: Allow pro-rata refunds for unused services and require reasonable notice for fee increases
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Fees are refundable on a pro-rata basis for unused services in case of early termination for cause. Fee increases require ninety (90) days notice and cannot exceed 10% annually.

risks.location: Customer grants Provider a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide license to use, modify, aggregate, and commercialize all data uploaded to the Platform, including for training machine learning models and resale to third parties
risks.explanation: Customer loses all rights to their own data permanently, including for commercial resale
risks.suggested_fix: Limit data use to service provision only, with anonymization requirements
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Provider may use Customer data solely to provide the Platform services. Any aggregated analytics must be anonymized and cannot identify Customer. No resale or commercialization rights granted.

risks.location: Any feedback, suggestions, or feature requests submitted by Customer become Provider's exclusive property. Provider may implement, patent, and commercialize such ideas without compensation
risks.explanation: Customer loses rights to their own ideas and feedback without compensation
risks.suggested_fix: Limit to non-exclusive license for feedback, exclude patentable inventions
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Customer grants Provider a non-exclusive license to use feedback for Platform improvements only. Customer retains ownership of any patentable inventions or proprietary methods.

risks.location: Customer acknowledges that data may be processed in any jurisdiction and stored with third-party subprocessors selected at Provider's discretion
risks.explanation: No data location controls or subprocessor approval rights, creating compliance risks
risks.suggested_fix: Require Customer approval for subprocessors and data location restrictions
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Provider shall obtain Customer's prior written consent for subprocessors handling Customer data and shall not transfer data outside [specified jurisdictions] without Customer approval.

risks.location: Provider targets 95% monthly uptime but this is an aspirational goal, not a commitment. No credits or remedies are available for downtime
risks.explanation: No enforceable service level commitments or remedies for poor performance
risks.suggested_fix: Include binding SLA with service credits for downtime
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Provider commits to 99.5% monthly uptime. For each full percentage point below this threshold, Customer receives a 5% service credit for that month.

risks.location: Provider is not responsible for data breaches, unauthorized access, or data loss. Customer is solely responsible for the security of login credentials
risks.explanation: Provider disclaims all security responsibility even for their own negligence
risks.suggested_fix: Allocate security responsibilities appropriately between parties
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Provider is responsible for Platform security measures and shall notify Customer of any data breaches within 24 hours. Customer is responsible for user access controls and credential management.

risks.location: This Agreement is governed by Delaware law. Disputes shall be resolved exclusively in Delaware state courts. Customer waives any objection to venue or personal jurisdiction
risks.explanation: Forces Customer to litigate in Provider's home jurisdiction, potentially inconvenient and expensive
risks.suggested_fix: Allow for alternative dispute resolution or neutral venue
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Disputes shall first be subject to mediation, then binding arbitration in a location mutually agreed upon by the parties or conducted virtually.

risks.location: Provider may modify Platform features, pricing, or these terms at any time. Material changes will be posted to Provider's website. Continued use after 30 days constitutes acceptance
risks.explanation: Unilateral modification rights without meaningful consent mechanism
risks.suggested_fix: Require Customer consent for material changes with opt-out rights
risks.rewrite_suggestion: Material changes require ninety (90) days advance notice and Customer's written consent. Customer may terminate without penalty if it objects to material changes.

missing_clauses: Business continuity and disaster recovery commitments
Audit rights for security and compliance
key_dates: Cancellation notice: 180 days prior to renewal
